40th Asian Racing Conference opens in Sapporo The 40th Asian Racing Conference (ARC) officially opened in Sapporo last night (Tuesday, 27 August), marking the ARCâ€™s return to Japan, where it was first staged in 1960. Delivering the opening address to the three-day Conference (28-30 August), Mr Engelbrecht-Bresges said: â€œIt is most fitting that the 40th edition of the ARC returns to its birthplace, Japan, and to celebrate the 70th birthday of the JRA (Japan Racing Association)." â€œOur industry is at a critical juncture and I firmly believe it is necessary that we critically review our current situation and how we reposition ourselves to secure our future. In this context, as leaders in our industry, we need to prepare for these challenges, but more importantly we have to advocate change, explore new ways of collaboration, and embrace new technology like AI (artificial intelligence) to help us to be more relevant to our customers." â€œThe way racing has been able to manage COVID has demonstrated how resilient and agile we can be, which makes me feel confident we can master these challenges.â€ Mr Engelbrecht-Bresges said these challenges could be met with a focus on goodwill and mutual understanding, promotion of horse racing and breeding and the integrity of our sport, encouraging and developing mutually beneficial objectives and strategies, exchanges of ideas and information and to encourage, promote, and support international competition of horses and jockeys. â€œWe have to focus on our current and future customers and the big vision; and not lose our focus due to our fragmentation and tendency to look backward and not forward,â€ Mr Engelbrecht-Bresges said. The Sapporo conference theme â€“ Be Connected, Stride Together â€“ features a dynamic and highly interactive three-day programme of guest speakers who will examine key post-pandemic trends in racing, breeding and wagering, equine and human welfare, international competition and integrity issues as well as several other key matters. ğŸ”— Read more: https://lnkd.in/g_FNWeNd #HKJC #ARC #JRA #HorseRacing

[The Hong Kong Jockey Club Supports the "Study Tour on Sports and Ecology in Sichuan for the Youth of Sha Tin" to Understand the Mainland Development] The Central Peopleâ€™s Government plans to send two giant pandas to Hong Kong. A recent study tour takes a group of young people to visit the giant panda base in Sichuan, experience local culture, visit historical sites and the Sichuan HKJC Olympic School, which was built with the Jockey Club's generous support. The young people also visited the Dujiangyan Irrigation System, deepening their understanding of the development of water conservancy projects in the Mainland. The study tour is sponsored by the Jockey Club, co-organized by Sha Tin District Youth Development and Civic Education Committee and the Hong Kong Children & Youth Services Jockey Club Heng On Integrated Children & Youth Services Centre, and fully supported by the Sha Tin District Office and the Sha Tin District Youth Network, including Sha Tin Assisant District Officer Tsang Ka-yi and Senior Consultant of External Affairs at Jockey Club Poon Tai-ping. The 5-day 4-night study tour enables the young people to learn about Sichuanâ€™s cultural heritage, and enhance their understanding and pride in the nation. #HKJC #HKJCCommunity
